themes: Need for higher standards in cultural funding
Distinction between commercial and cultural activities
Concerns about misuse of public funds
key_phrases: Do not be afraid to make some people unhappy
raise the bar for what constitutes the type of cultural work that is worthy of government financial support
why should public money fund crafts markets for jewelry, candle and soap makers
commercial endeavors to sell consumer goods
no lack of soap, candles or jewelry in hundreds of shops literally all over Austin
Queer Black Feminist theatre is not common at all and should be supported by public funds
barriers_identified: Public funding going to commercial rather than cultural activities
Lack of clear standards for what constitutes cultural work
solutions_proposed: Raise the bar for what constitutes cultural work worthy of government financial support
Do not subsidize commercial crafts markets
Support rare and underrepresented cultural forms such as Queer Black Feminist theatre
